returns._0: Amount of seconds after pool expiry which allows swaps, no swaps after buffer
Amount of liquidity burned on `create()` calls
Precision units to scale to when doing token related calculations

params.poolId: Keccak256 hash of the engine address, strike, sigma, maturity, and gamma

returns.gamma: Multiplied against swap in amounts to apply fee, equal to 1 - fee % but units are in basis points, valid for (9_000, 10_000)
returns.lastTimestamp: Last timestamp used to calculate time until expiry, aka "tau"
returns.maturity: Timestamp which starts the BUFFER countdown until swaps will cease, in seconds, valid for (block.timestamp, 2^32-1]
returns.sigma: AKA Implied Volatility in basis points, determines the price impact of swaps, valid for (1, 10_000_000)
returns.strike: Marginal price of the pool's risky token at maturity, with the same decimals as the stable token, valid [0, 2^128-1]

params.poolId: Keccak256 hash of the engine address, strike, sigma, maturity, and gamma

returns.invariant: Signed fixed point 64.64 number, invariant of `poolId`

params.poolId: Keccak256 hash of the engine address, strike, sigma, maturity, and gamma
Keccak256 hash of the engine address, strike, sigma, maturity, and gamma

returns.blockTimestamp: Timestamp when the cumulative reserve values were last updated
returns.cumulativeLiquidity: Cumulative sum of total supply of liquidity of the previous update
returns.cumulativeRisky: Cumulative sum of risky token reserves of the previous update
returns.cumulativeStable: Cumulative sum of stable token reserves of the previous update
returns.liquidity: Total supply of liquidity for the curve
returns.reserveRisky: Risky token balance in the reserve
returns.reserveStable: Stable token balance in the reserve

returns._0: Multiplier to scale amounts to/from, equal to 10^(18 - riskyDecimals)
Multiplier to scale amounts to/from, equal to 10^(18 - stableDecimals)
Stable token address, a more accurate name is the quote token

invariantOf(bytes32).notice: Fetches the current invariant, notation is usually `k`, based on risky and stable token reserves of pool with `poolId`

liquidity(address,bytes32).notice: Fetches position liquidity an account address and poolId

reserves(bytes32).notice: Fetches the global reserve state for a pool with `poolId`

documentation.text: @return Precision units to scale to when doing token related calculations
@return Amount of seconds after pool expiry which allows swaps, no swaps after buffer
@return Amount of liquidity burned on `create()` calls
@return Stable token address, a more accurate name is the quote token
@return Multiplier to scale amounts to/from, equal to 10^(18 - riskyDecimals)
@return Multiplier to scale amounts to/from, equal to 10^(18 - stableDecimals)

@title  View functions of the Primitive Engine contract
 @author Primitive
